lexUnit.name: sparkle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shine brightly with flashes of light.

sentence.text: The eyes sparkled with renewed malignancy , but the cripple said nothing .
Isobel was laughing at something Edouard had just said ; she was wearing a white linen suit , her green eyes sparkled .
His eyes sparkled with delight as her mannerisms and voice reminded him of just how attractive he found Englishwomen .
She waited until the governess had hurried from the room , her eyes sparkling with tears .
She was laughing at her grandmother , her eyes sparkling with amusement .
Cassowary 's little eyes sparkled with greed .
The throne was made of gold , and sparkled with a multitude of jewels .
East and north , vast Flow Country peatlands sparkle blue and silver with lochs and lochans .
She still had on the revealing silk blouse she had worn in the show , with stage jewellery sparkling at her throat and breast .
Behind their perimeter walls lie freshly laundered flowers , verdant grass still sparkling from the last shower , yew hedges in an ecstasy of precision clipping .
The jewels sparkled in the candlelight and the guests gasped at the sheer magnificence of the piece .
She smiled , tears still sparkling in her eyes .
He came on , walking in the same direction as Rachaela , the dilute snow sparkling in his hat like sequins .
He loved the way she smelt , the atmosphere with which she surrounded you , the way she gestured , the ear-rings that sparkled in the light when she turned her head quickly .
It sparkled like a Christmas tree .
At last , dripping wet , with water sparkling like jewels on her cheeks and forehead , and rivulets running from her hair , she stepped from the last stone on to the bank .
Golden rays beamed down like spotlights , transforming the charcoal water to sapphire-blue and making the streaks of foam sparkle like sugar frosting .
Now in that room at Fontainebleau so many years ago , I studied Francis but my eyes were drawn to that bloody ring which sparkled on the fourth finger of his left hand .
The drops sparkled on the glass , then vanished with the whining stroke of the wipers , as Jean strained to see ahead of her .
Tears sparkled on her lashes .
Flecks of rain sparkled on the shoulders of his navy-blue overcoat .
At eighty she sparkled with cheerfulness and good humour .
Wet blades of grass gleamed like so many tiny polished green spears in the early evening sunshine and the gorse bushes sparkled with diamond drops .
The redhead 's hair sparkled with tiny ice crystals .
At night , the whole valley sparkles with lights from the hillside villages .
This is a scene which calls for imaginative lighting The tree and its decorations should sparkle against darker backgrounds .
Far below , the sea sparkled under a shimmering haze of heat .
The gold threads and the jewels woven through it sparkled in the light of the lamps .
As she did he saw the ring on the third finger of her left hand ; the large diamond sparkled brightly .
Even in the thin winter light her amethyst necklace in its fine golden setting sparkled prettily .
Suddenly the sea was sparkling and the golf course a glittering green .
